main event: On May 6, 1962, two F-102 jet interceptors tracked an unidentified object by radar in the Atlantic Ocean at coordinates 44N 49W for 15 minutes.
interesting points: The unidentified object was observed at speeds between 1,000 and 3,000 knots., The object made a rapid change in course during the tracking., Visibility was reported to be good and weather clear during the sighting., A probable meteor or meteorite sighting was reported in the same area shortly after the U.S. Navy's sighting., The object was described as being 30-75 feet in diameter and emitted no sound.
witness description: Pilot and crew of Air Force jet interceptors
